content:
I noticed that Try this: tactics which suggest multiple options (like rw?) currently take up a lot of space in the infoview by repeating the tryThis widget over and over (so that each individual suggestion has a "Tactic replacement" summary header, followed by Try this:).

Is there any desire for tryThese? It's not difficult to adapt the existing code to handle arrays of suggestions:

If so, would this be better as an addition to mathlib4 or directly to std4, as they both have TryThis files? (Or try it out in mathlib4, then upstream later?) I'd be happy to PR. :)
Yes please! These would be great for all of have? rw? and apply?.
Please aim directly for Std, as we're trying to upstream apply?, so it's best not to add further dependencies in Mathlib.
Thank you! IIRC hint in lean 3 would give a short list of suggested tactics in a similar way.
As it happens, this was actually motivated by reviewing @Pol'tta / Miyahara K≈ç's very nice port of hint (#5363)! :)
Btw, this PR (std4#215) is awaiting review, but I don't seem to be able to label it. If someone who can would like to do so (or give me the ability to do so, I suppose), please feel free. :)
I've added the label for you, and will start a discussion in the Std stream about handing out the triage role to all contributors.
